jobs.title: Content Strategist and Copywriter
jobs.description:
The Company

HeliosX is a ground-breaking group of medtech and health companies, comprising Dermatica, MedExpress and Zip Health. We are an already successful team of over 40 people, and are continuing to grow across the pharmaceutical, cosmetics, and nutrition supplements spaces as well as expanding into the US (through Zip Health). We service over half a million patients in the UK providing tailored consultation and personalised prescription services helping people treat a wide range of conditions.

Additionally, we have a vibrant, stand-alone Vitamin/food supplement brand, Beauty & The Bear, which we are looking to grow internationally.

We are dedicated to improving the quality, accessibility and affordability of healthcare for every person on the planet.

The Role

We are seeking a talented and experienced Content Strategist and Content Writer who will be able to take ownership of both the strategic planning of when and where to deploy great, focused content for maximum effect (c75% of the role), as well as contributing by writing copy themselves (c.25% of the role) Working extremely closely with our medical experts, marketing and tech teams, you will be given the opportunity to help us continue to define and grow the presence of an already exceptional product and to raise awareness of the positive impacts our treatments are making.

You will be crafting all copy needs for:

* Web copy including product copy, homepage, landing pages for projects and brand information
* Create and publish engaging content for brand touch points
* Marketing campaign copy - creative concept copy to accompany seasonal campaigns for external documents
* Manage and own internal documentation to ensure clarity within internal teams
* Weekly editorial blog posts – written, commissioned or checked copy, anything from brand education, product blogs, campaign write-ups to a detailed piece on Health-Tech.
* Weekly social copy – written or sourced. Providing creative & copy support for the social media manager
* 7Edit, proofread and improve writers’ posts i.e medical, PR, Social, ext.
* Support on press releases, collaborations, events and product launches (with input from global PR agencies)
* Seasonal POS, Packaging, Leaflets, Product booklets
* Supporting ecom team as needed with translations service for web copy
* Optimise content according to SEO

Key responsibilities

* Accountable for all content marketing initiatives to drive traffic and usage of all brands
* You will create a content marketing calendar for social, email, events & newsletter distribution & manage the process around enabling input and buy-in from key stakeholders at the right time.
* Develop content strategy aligned with short-term and long-term marketing targets
* Stay up-to-date with developments and generate new ideas to draw the audience's attention
* Liaise with outsourced content writers to ensure brand consistency
* Ensure compliance with law (e.g. copyright and GDPR)
* You will understand what is best practice in terms of social media channels, & which content and approaches work on each and why
* You will measure and optimize the content marketing programme on a regular and ongoing basis
* You will create feedback loops back into the business on campaign approaches and results which clearly show an understanding of why and how successful your content strategy has been across various channels and customer touch points
* Use content management systems to analyse website traffic and users’ engagement metrics

Requirements


Skills

BA/BS or equivalent working experience

Expert copywriting skills with the ability to spot what is and is not good copy.

A natural & instinctive content mindset that enables you to generate content ideas.

Experience creating and amplifying existing content for the web and growing a social audience, ideally with health/pharmaceutical-related products

Editorial mindset that seeks to understand what audiences consume and then how to work with the content team to maximize content value.

Reader-centric copywriting & accurate editing skills

Negotiation and influencing skills in order to determine & deliver the content requirements for campaigns

Experience with a CMS, Google analytics, and the top social channels

Project management skills and understanding how to manage the priorities of multiple stakeholders

Exceptional organizational and project management skills, ability to manage multiple projects.

Benefits

What will you get in return?

* The opportunity to join a business with amazing growth, best-in-class products and all the fun of a start-up with none of the instability or risk!
* Competitive salary
* 25 days' holiday
* Health insurance
* Fruit and snacks in the office
* Monthly social (drinks)
* Lunch on Fridays
* Pension scheme
* We are working on enhancing our benefits package and would welcome your contribution!

jobs.title: Head of Growth
jobs.description:
Head of Growth, Marketing

Reporting to CEO

The Role

We’re looking for someone who really understands growth; .... in the sense that Andrew Chen and Brian Balfour write about (if you don’t know who they are, this role might not be for you - have a google!). This role is not really about executing a known plan, nor optimising an existing machine. It's not even about building a machine. It's earlier stage than that - it's about figuring out what the machine needs to do in the first place, then building a bit of it, seeing what happens, then building some more. The answer will be as much about operations and product as it is about marketing. In fact, getting it right will mean a lot LESS marketing activity. The Head of Growth will be in charge of this piece of work, although it depends critically on lots of contributions from everyone else in the business. Interactions with the Product and Tech teams will be vital and the more experience you have in this, the better.

Things we value highly: senior growth/marketing experience especially in a startup environment; any startup experience; a humble and down to earth character; very high IQ and EQ.

As Head of Growth, you will take on full responsibility for our brands, Dermatica, MedExpress, Beauty & The Bear, online and offline, managing agencies, managing and growing the in-house Marketing team of five, establishing and driving the metrics, strategy and execution - anything that drives our business objectives and influences the bottom line.

We are looking for a strategic leader able to balance big-picture thinking with deep-dive research and data-driven marketing based on rapid experimentation. You will come up with a growth strategy for some brands and optimise for others, then test and iterate fast based on learnings.

You will work closely with the Product, Design, Tech, and Pharma teams and will report directly to the CEO.






The Company

We are a group of health tech companies under one umbrella, and a rapidly growing team of 35 sitting in the heart of Shoreditch. We operate a number of brands and ventures in medical, dermatology, and nutritional supplement sectors.

We service over half a million patients in the UK providing tailored consultation and personalised prescription services helping people treat a wide range of conditions.

We are dedicated to improving the quality, accessibility and affordability of healthcare for every person on the planet.

We are very excited to have launched in the US market in Q3 2019. Currently we are one of only a handful of companies to operate in both Europe and the US and have a unique platform to deliver growth and make a real impact to the welfare of hundreds of millions of potential patients.



Responsibilities will include:

* Leading, coaching and growing our Marketing team;
* Collaborating across marketing, technology and operations to drive forwards the product offering
* Establishing marketing strategy and OKRs together with other departments;
* Bringing traditional and creative ideas on how to optimise ROI and deliver OKRs; Priorisation and management of marketing and technology resources to meet deliverables
* Testing and optimising marketing tactics for customer acquisition (e.g. advertising, affiliate, referral, email, social, influencers, etc.);
* Rapid experimentation including A/B testing
* Analysing data and users’ feedback together with the Design team;
* Fostering lean startup environment;
* Scaling and Automating the growth processes.





Requirements


We would like to hear from you if you are / have:

* Senior Growth/Marketing experience, especially in startups or high growth businesses at scale-up stages;

* Data-driven: Emphasis on quantitative measurement, scenario modeling via spreadsheets, and a lot of database queries.

* Fluent in the full spectrum of acquisition channels;
* Understanding of the technical side of digital marketing including page load times, email deliverability, schema.org markup etc
* Solid understanding behind the statistics of A/B testing; you should be familiar with the concepts of variance, confidence intervals and hypothesis testing;
* Understanding of behavioural psychology and how it relates to UX and messaging
* A deep understanding of all stages of the funnel and experience in funnel optimisation

Benefits

Great salary

Flexible working hours

Deliveroo lunches on a Friday(!)

Healthcare

Discretionary Bonus

An awesome team of bright and motivated people to work with!!

jobs.title: PPC/Paid Social Media Manager
jobs.description:
The Company

HeliosX is a ground-breaking group of medtech and health companies, comprising MedExpress, Dermatica, Zip Health and Beauty & The Bear. We are an already successful team of over 40 people, and are continuing to grow across the pharmaceutical, cosmetics, and nutrition supplements spaces as well as expanding into the US (through Zip Health). We service over half a million patients in the UK providing tailored consultation and personalised prescription services helping people treat a wide range of conditions.

We are dedicated to improving the quality, accessibility and affordability of healthcare for every person on the planet.

The Role

As an integral member of the team who are the engine of our growth, you’ll use your creativity and expertise to drive views, clicks, shares, new users, downloads, and sales. You’ll work with an awesome team to come up with innovative and cutting-edge campaigns, translating data and analytics into something which our customers and potential customers love to engage with.

It is said that strangers are simply friends we haven’t met yet. Potential customers are people our brands haven’t amazed yet!

Managing a significant, £multi-million budget (c.95% for PPC) your role will be critical in maintaining and enhancing our growth trajectory through top-quality planning and campaign management, with the support of our external agency partners (in SEO and CRO)

Requirements

What will make you awesome for this job??

* Great experience in managing PPC/Paid Social (ideally in a B2C tech or medical/pharmaceutical environment)
* Strong understanding of funnel marketing and statistics (eg. confidence intervals and how this relates to PPC)
* Account maintenance/optimisation
* Experience setting up new campaigns (eg. Google ads)
* Experience of display advertising
* Experience of keyword research
* Experience of A/B testing copy
* Strong knowledge of Google Analytics

Benefits

What will you get in return?

* The opportunity to join a business with amazing growth, best-in-class products and all the fun of a start-up with none of the instability or risk!
* Competitive salary
* 25 days’ holiday
* Health insurance
* Fruit and snacks in the office
* Monthly social (drinks)
* Lunch on Fridays
* Pension scheme
* We are working on enhancing our benefits package and would welcome your contribution!

Send through your CV now for consideration - we look forward to welcoming you to our team!
